page.title: 07STROUD RAILWAYS
page.content: Stroud G.W.R. station was opened in 1845. Until 1872 it was Broad Gauge it had a round water tower but that was demonished in 1970.The station is still in daily use with trains for stations to London (Paddington) on on the up line and trains to Worcester on the down line.The station is manned 24 hours a day 7 days a week with only six people working there.In the busier time of 1960, 24 people worked there. Stroud Midland station,a timber stucture was opened in 1884 and closed in 1947 for passengers and 1966 for goods.It is now an industrial estate. The viaduct to it was demonished in 1983.Some of the bricks were used to build a tunnel on the Strafford park 1/8 of a mile long miniature rail way owned by the Stroud society of model engineers.
